Issue #26 Mega Désert 2000 S. Peterhansel/J. P. Cottret

The 22nd edition of the Dakar offered a considerable surprise: for the first time the rally crossed Africa from west to east, from Senegal toward Egypt. Starting January 6 in Dakar, Senegal the rally continued through Mail, Burkina Faso, Niger, Libya, and finished at the foot of the pyramids in Egypt on January 23 for a total of 3,114 competitive miles. However, upon arrival in Niger, the rally received threats of a terrorist attack and the organizers decided to suspend the race at Niamey for 5 days. The decision was then made to organize a huge airlift between Niamey, Niger and Sabha, Libya, using Antonov 124 transport planes to transport the entire rally - people and machines!

Aixam was a French automobile manufacturer founded in 1983 to make microcars. 10 years after the creation of Aixam the company became Aixam-Mega with the creation of a range of standard sized cars under the Mega brand. 2000 was Mega's first participation in the Dakar rally with the Mega Désert.

After winning the Dakar 6 times on a motorcycle, this was Peterhansel's second outing in a 4-wheeled vehicle and it was quite successful. Even though they only won 2 stages, Peterhansel and Cottret finished in a remarkable second place!
